heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 27.0mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: The last storm was on 08 October 2025 which lasted for 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (176°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (232.0°) by approximately 56.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.5°C) and outside temperature (up 2.9°C).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 314 m) and light levels (up 4081 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 5704 lux) and cloud levels (up 396 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 314.2m lower than yesterday, 297.8m lower than the past week, 395.9m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 949m to 2390m and averaged 1223.2m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; mild temperatures are expected. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and winds will be practically absent. Possible light showers, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and bright intervals likely. High pressure will dominate, leading to stable weather.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
